snippet: Roving teams of state inspectors will begin random roadside testing of diesel smoke from heavy trucks and buses next spring under a new program adopted by the State Air Resources Board.   The program, approved by a vote of 7 to 1 on Thursday, will...
lead_paragraph: Roving teams of state inspectors will begin random roadside testing of diesel smoke from heavy trucks and buses next spring under a new program adopted by the State Air Resources Board. The program, approved by a vote of 7 to 1 on Thursday, will apply to all heavy trucks and buses in the state, regardless of where they are registered.

headline.main: NEW EMISSION TEST FOR HEAVY TRUCKS
